summary: Potassium nitrate (KNO3) is a chemical compound with a sharp, salty, bitter taste. It's found in nature as a mineral called niter and is used in fertilizers, tree stump removal, rocket fuel, and fireworks. It's also a key ingredient in gunpowder. In food, it gives processed meats their red color. This compound is a source of nitrogen, which is why nitrogen is named after it.
title: Potassium nitrate
